description: Ms. codex. Physical description: 12 lines per page; written in large naskh in black on glazed, laid European paper. Rubrication and catchwords. Mild staining. Origin: 10 Shaʻbān 1250 H [12 December 1834] (leaf 168b). Text 1 originally completed on 11 Rajab 1242 H [8 February 1827] (leaf 77a).
author: Rashtī, Kāẓim ibn Qāsim, -1843
abstract: Collection of two texts on Shiʻite rituals.
extent: 168 leaves : paper ; 211 x 149 (165 x 100) mm bound to 214 x 152 mm
title: Risālah fī fiqh al-ṣalāh al-yawmīyah ; Risālah fī fiqh al-ṣiyām.
creator: رشتي، كاظم بن قاسم، -1843
subject: Manuscripts, Arabic—New Jersey—Princeton
binding note: Full brown leather with blind-stamping; recycled from a larger cover.
member of collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
